1→# Octodeco - AI Agent Instructions
     2→
     3→## Project Overview
     4→Octodeco is a Next.js 16 App Router e-commerce demo for an online sticker shop featuring GitHub Octocat-themed products. Built with React 19, TypeScript 5, and Tailwind CSS 4.
     5→
     6→## Tech Stack
     7→- **Next.js 16** App Router (server components by default)
     8→- **React 19** with TypeScript 5
     9→- **Tailwind CSS 4** with inline theme configuration
    10→- **ESLint** with Next.js config
    11→
    12→## Architecture
    13→
    14→### Directory Structure
    15→```
    16→app/
    17→  ├── api/products/          # Product data (products.json)
    18→  ├── page.tsx               # Homepage
    19→  ├── layout.tsx             # Root layout with Geist fonts
    20→  └── globals.css            # Tailwind config + CSS variables
    21→.github/
    22→  ├── agents/                # Custom agent definitions (.agent.md)
    23→  ├── prompts/               # Reusable prompts (.prompt.md)
    24→  └── copilot-instructions.md
    25→public/images/products/      # Product images (Octocat stickers)
    26→```
    27→
    28→### Key Files
    29→- `app/api/products/products.json` - Product catalog with 20 Octocat stickers
    30→- `.github/agents/simplifier.agent.md` - Code simplification agent
    31→- `.github/prompts/products-page.prompt.md` - Template for creating product pages
    32→
    33→## Development Workflow
    34→
    35→### Commands
    36→```bash
    37→npm run dev    # Start dev server on localhost:3000
    38→npm run build  # Production build
    39→npm run lint   # Run ESLint
    40→```
    41→
    42→### No Test Framework Yet
    43→This project currently has no test setup. When adding tests, prefer Vitest or Playwright based on project needs.
    44→
    45→## Code Conventions
    46→
    47→### TypeScript & Imports
    48→- Use `@/*` path alias for project imports: `import { Product } from "@/app/types"`
    49→- Type-only imports: `import type { Metadata } from "next"`
    50→- Import order: React → external packages → internal modules → types
    51→- Prefer `function` keyword over arrow functions for components
    52→- Add explicit return types for exported functions
    53→
    54→### React 19 & Next.js 16 Patterns
    55→- **Server Components by default** - Only add `'use client'` when using:
    56→  - React hooks (useState, useEffect, etc.)
    57→  - Browser APIs (localStorage, window, etc.)
    58→  - Event handlers
    59→- Place `'use client'` at the very top of the file (line 1)
    60→- Use `next/image` with explicit `width` and `height` props
    61→- Simple component props: inline types `function Card({ title }: { title: string })`
    62→- Complex component props: separate interface `interface ProductCardProps { ... }`
    63→
    64→### Styling with Tailwind CSS 4
    65→- Use Tailwind utility classes exclusively (no custom CSS beyond `globals.css`)
    66→- Design tokens defined in `globals.css`:
    67→  - `bg-background` / `text-foreground` for theme colors
    68→  - `--font-sans` (Geist) / `--font-mono` (Geist Mono)
    69→- Dark mode support via `dark:` variants (though light mode is primary focus)
    70→- Avoid nested ternaries in className conditions - prefer explicit conditionals
    71→
    72→### Client-Side Data Patterns
    73→When using localStorage or browser APIs:
    74→```typescript
    75→'use client'
    76→const [data, setData] = useState(null)
    77→const [isHydrated, setIsHydrated] = useState(false)
    78→
    79→useEffect(() => {
    80→  if (typeof window !== 'undefined') {
    81→    try {
    82→      const stored = localStorage.getItem('key')
    83→      setData(stored)
    84→    } catch (error) {
    85→      // Handle private browsing mode
    86→    }
    87→  }
    88→  setIsHydrated(true)
    89→}, [])
    90→```
    91→
    92→## Custom Agent & Skills Workflow
    93→
    94→### Agent Skills
    95→This project is configured for GitHub Copilot Agent Skills:
    96→- Skills can be installed via `npx add-skill <repo>`
    97→- Skills are defined in `.github/skills/<skill-name>/SKILL.md`
    98→- Skills extend agent capabilities with domain expertise
    99→- Skills auto-discovered by agents when relevant
   100→
   101→### Custom Prompts
   102→Reusable prompts in `.github/prompts/*.prompt.md`:
   103→- Invoked with `/prompt-name` in agent chat
   104→- Example: `/products-page` creates product pages following project standards
   105→
   106→### Custom Agents
   107→- `.github/agents/simplifier.agent.md` - Code simplifier specialized for this stack
   108→- Agents automatically apply project conventions during refactoring
   109→
   110→## Project-Specific Context
   111→
   112→### Product Data
   113→- Products served from `app/api/products/products.json`
   114→- Each product has: id, name, description, price, image path, category
   115→- Images located at `/images/products/{filename}.png`
   116→- Price range: $3-6 for stickers
   117→
   118→### Visual Design
   119→- **Light mode first** - white backgrounds with black header/footer
   120→- Logo: `original.png` (the original Octocat)
   121→- Geist font family (sans and mono variants)
   122→- Production-grade, polished UI expected in all implementations
   123→
   124→## Common Pitfalls to Avoid
   125→- Don't add `'use client'` unless necessary (check if you're using hooks/browser APIs)
   126→- Don't use custom CSS - leverage Tailwind utilities
   127→- Don't forget `width` and `height` on `next/image` components
   128→- Don't skip the `typeof window !== 'undefined'` check for browser APIs
   129→- Don't use arrow functions for components - use `function` keyword
   130→

file.content:
# Octodeco - AI Agent Instructions

## Project Overview
Octodeco is a Next.js 16 App Router e-commerce demo for an online sticker shop featuring GitHub Octocat-themed products. Built with React 19, TypeScript 5, and Tailwind CSS 4.

## Tech Stack
- **Next.js 16** App Router (server components by default)
- **React 19** with TypeScript 5
- **Tailwind CSS 4** with inline theme configuration
- **ESLint** with Next.js config

## Architecture

### Directory Structure
```
app/
  ├── api/products/          # Product data (products.json)
  ├── page.tsx               # Homepage
  ├── layout.tsx             # Root layout with Geist fonts
  └── globals.css            # Tailwind config + CSS variables
.github/
  ├── agents/                # Custom agent definitions (.agent.md)
  ├── prompts/               # Reusable prompts (.prompt.md)
  └── copilot-instructions.md
public/images/products/      # Product images (Octocat stickers)
```

### Key Files
- `app/api/products/products.json` - Product catalog with 20 Octocat stickers
- `.github/agents/simplifier.agent.md` - Code simplification agent
- `.github/prompts/products-page.prompt.md` - Template for creating product pages

## Development Workflow

### Commands
```bash
npm run dev    # Start dev server on localhost:3000
npm run build  # Production build
npm run lint   # Run ESLint
```

### No Test Framework Yet
This project currently has no test setup. When adding tests, prefer Vitest or Playwright based on project needs.

## Code Conventions

### TypeScript & Imports
- Use `@/*` path alias for project imports: `import { Product } from "@/app/types"`
- Type-only imports: `import type { Metadata } from "next"`
- Import order: React → external packages → internal modules → types
- Prefer `function` keyword over arrow functions for components
- Add explicit return types for exported functions

### React 19 & Next.js 16 Patterns
- **Server Components by default** - Only add `'use client'` when using:
  - React hooks (useState, useEffect, etc.)
  - Browser APIs (localStorage, window, etc.)
  - Event handlers
- Place `'use client'` at the very top of the file (line 1)
- Use `next/image` with explicit `width` and `height` props
- Simple component props: inline types `function Card({ title }: { title: string })`
- Complex component props: separate interface `interface ProductCardProps { ... }`

### Styling with Tailwind CSS 4
- Use Tailwind utility classes exclusively (no custom CSS beyond `globals.css`)
- Design tokens defined in `globals.css`:
  - `bg-background` / `text-foreground` for theme colors
  - `--font-sans` (Geist) / `--font-mono` (Geist Mono)
- Dark mode support via `dark:` variants (though light mode is primary focus)
- Avoid nested ternaries in className conditions - prefer explicit conditionals

### Client-Side Data Patterns
When using localStorage or browser APIs:
```typescript
'use client'
const [data, setData] = useState(null)
const [isHydrated, setIsHydrated] = useState(false)

useEffect(() => {
  if (typeof window !== 'undefined') {
    try {
      const stored = localStorage.getItem('key')
      setData(stored)
    } catch (error) {
      // Handle private browsing mode
    }
  }
  setIsHydrated(true)
}, [])
```

## Custom Agent & Skills Workflow

### Agent Skills
This project is configured for GitHub Copilot Agent Skills:
- Skills can be installed via `npx add-skill <repo>`
- Skills are defined in `.github/skills/<skill-name>/SKILL.md`
- Skills extend agent capabilities with domain expertise
- Skills auto-discovered by agents when relevant

### Custom Prompts
Reusable prompts in `.github/prompts/*.prompt.md`:
- Invoked with `/prompt-name` in agent chat
- Example: `/products-page` creates product pages following project standards

### Custom Agents
- `.github/agents/simplifier.agent.md` - Code simplifier specialized for this stack
- Agents automatically apply project conventions during refactoring

## Project-Specific Context

### Product Data
- Products served from `app/api/products/products.json`
- Each product has: id, name, description, price, image path, category
- Images located at `/images/products/{filename}.png`
- Price range: $3-6 for stickers

### Visual Design
- **Light mode first** - white backgrounds with black header/footer
- Logo: `original.png` (the original Octocat)
- Geist font family (sans and mono variants)
- Production-grade, polished UI expected in all implementations

## Common Pitfalls to Avoid
- Don't add `'use client'` unless necessary (check if you're using hooks/browser APIs)
- Don't use custom CSS - leverage Tailwind utilities
- Don't forget `width` and `height` on `next/image` components
- Don't skip the `typeof window !== 'undefined'` check for browser APIs
- Don't use arrow functions for components - use `function` keyword

content.thinking:
Perfect! I've successfully completed the task:

1. Created a products page at `app/products/page.tsx` that:
   - Displays all 20 products from the products.json file
   - Uses a responsive grid layout (1-4 columns depending on screen size)
   - Shows product images, names, descriptions, prices, and categories
   - Includes a header with navigation and footer
   - Follows all the project conventions (server component, Tailwind, Geist fonts, etc.)

2. Updated the landing page at `app/page.tsx` to:
   - Feature Octodeco branding with the original Octocat logo
   - Include a hero section with a clear call-to-action button linking to /products
   - Add an about section highlighting the key features
   - Include a header with navigation to the products page
   - Include a footer matching the products page

3. Updated the layout metadata to reflect Octodeco branding

The implementation follows all the project conventions from the copilot-instructions.md:
- Server components (no 'use client' directive needed)
- Function keyword for components
- Tailwind CSS utilities exclusively
- Light mode first with white backgrounds and black header/footer
- next/image with explicit width and height props
- Production-grade, polished UI
- Type imports using `import type`
- Proper TypeScript interfaces for the Product type

Let me summarize this for the user.

content.text:
Perfect! I've successfully created the products page and updated the homepage for Octodeco. Here's what I've done:

## Created Products Page
Created `/app/products/page.tsx` with:
- A responsive product grid displaying all 20 Octocat stickers from the products.json file
- Product cards showing images, names, descriptions, prices, and categories
- Responsive layout (1-4 columns based on screen size)
- Black header with navigation and footer matching the brand style
- Server-side data fetching to load products from the JSON file

## Updated Homepage
Updated `/app/page.tsx` to:
- Feature Octodeco branding with the original Octocat logo
- Include a hero section with a prominent "Browse Stickers" button linking to `/products`
- Add an about section highlighting 20 unique designs, affordable prices, and high quality
- Include matching header with "Products" navigation link
- Add consistent footer styling

## Updated Metadata
Updated `/app/layout.tsx` metadata to reflect Octodeco branding instead of the default Next.js text.

The implementation follows all project conventions:
- Server components (no unnecessary 'use client' directives)
- Tailwind CSS utilities exclusively
- Light mode design with white backgrounds and black header/footer
- next/image with explicit dimensions
- Production-grade, polished UI

You can now navigate between the homepage (/) and products page (/products) using the navigation links in the header or the "Browse Stickers" button on the homepage!
